page.description: The Chart Control is used by several other components and subsystems: the Web Chart Component, Reports, the Chart Alternate View, and desktop Forms. This article explains the common functionality provided by the Chart Control Genie. Charting is built into the Dialog Component (called the UX component in V12 and above) and into Reports.

section.description: The screen shot above shows the default chart setup dialog; this particular one was brought up from the desktop Form Designer. The table below lists all the controls that can appear on the Chart property sheet, and describes each one's usage.

case.title: Chart Type
case.description: Bar Vertical Grouped, Bar Vertical Stacked, Bar Vertical Overlaid, Bar Horizontal Grouped, Bar Horizontal Stacked, Line, Area, Spline, SplineArea, StackedArea, Radar, Pie, Doughnut, Funnel, Pyramid, Stock, Candlestick, Bubble.

case.title: 3d Appearance
case.description: Use three-dimension effects?

case.title: Effects
case.description: Other chart effects; what is offered depends on the chart type and 3d setting. Possible options are None, Concave, SoftEdge, Circle, Polygon, Line, Marker, Area, Circular Base, Square Base, Cylinder, Emboss, Light To Dark, Wedge

case.title: Source
case.description: Table, SQL, Custom, or (in the context of a report) Report

case.title: Table
case.description: Table or Set name, only offered if Source is Table

case.title: Connection
case.description: SQL connection, only offered if Source is SQL

case.title: Select Statement
case.description: SQL select statement, only offered if Source is SQL

case.title: Use Portable SQL
case.description: Portable or native SQL syntax, only offered if Source is SQL

case.title: Arguments
case.description: Not offered if Source is Report

case.title: Argument Bindings
case.description: Not offered if Source is Report

case.title: Filter records
case.description: Filter the data being graphed (optional additional global filter). Only offered if Source is Table

case.title: Custom Source
case.description: Populate chart from Xbasic. Only shown if Source is Custom

case.title: Custom Watch
case.description: Trigger re-populate of chart when value changes. Only shown if Source is Custom

case.title: Series Type
case.description: How series is populated. Single means plot one series only, multiple record means same column, but separate records, multiple column means multiple values are plotted from a single record. Only offered if chart type supports multiple series

case.title: Series
case.description: Data series group key (used to define the key to use for each series). Only offered if chart type supports multiple series and this is in a report context

case.title: Series Expression
case.description: Expression to generate the series break/order. Used as label if Series Label Expression is not defined. Only shown for Multiple Record series

case.title: Series Label Expression
case.description: Expression to generate the label for each series entry. Only shown for Multiple Record series

case.title: Plot Series on Axis
case.description: Instead of plotting category along the x axis, plot the Series. Category used for the legend. If this option is left off, Category gets plotted on the axis, Series is used for the legend. Only shown when there are multiple series

case.title: Summarization
case.description: Select sample data versus summarize data. Options are Value, Summary, Count, Average, Standard Deviation, First, Last, Min, Max

case.title: Data
case.description: Data points to sample. Only shown when the series type is not Multiple Column

case.title: Data Columns
case.description: Opens an editor for Series names and expressions

case.title: Sample unique
case.description: Pick expression on which to group summarization unique values. Only shown if Summarization is Value and source type is not Report

case.title: Sample at
case.description: Select the report group at which to sample each value. Only shown if source type is Report. The Sample at group must be within the Sample Over group.

case.title: Sample Over
case.description: Select the report group to sample each value over. Only shown if source type is Report

case.title: Data Label
case.description: Optional data label expression for chart. Used to label the data points.

case.title: Explode slice
case.description: Optional data point pie chart exploded setting. Only shown for Pie charts.

case.title: Category
case.description: expression. Field that indicates grouping and order for data points if X axis contains labels.

case.title: Category Label
case.description: expression. Optional Category label override (if omitted, Category will be used).

case.title: Chart Title
case.description: Expression for title to display on chart.

case.title: X Axis Title
case.description: Expression for x-axis title to display on chart.

case.title: Y Axis Title
case.description: Expression for y-axis title to display on chart.

case.title: Data Label Placement
case.description: Auto, None, Legend, or Chart

case.title: Include Zero
case.description: Include zero in the y axis

case.title: Show Breaks
case.description: Show breaks in sparse graph data

case.title: Chart Style
case.description: Edit stylesheet (colors, line styles and fonts)

case.title: Event Handler
case.description: Code to handle chart mouse events. Prototype is as shown below.

section.example:
' Handle a click on graph data function OnClickData as c( e as p ) ' e contains ' e.obj(P) - pointer to objects ' e.series(N) - series # ' e.index(N) - data # ' e.data(N) - data value end function
' Handle a flyover event on graph data function OnFlyoverData as c( e as p ) end function
' Handle a click on graph series function OnClickLegend as c( e as p ) end function
' Handle a flyover event on graph series function OnFlyoverLegend as c( e as p ) end function

case.title: Layout Editors - Embedded Charts
case.description: Video Number DT2. Alpha Anywhere introduces a powerful charting engine. Charts can be used in Form, Reports, Labels, Letters, Xdialogs, and Web Components. This video shows how a chart can be embedded into a form.

case.title: Charts - Xdialog Examples
case.description: Video Number DT3. The charting features in Alpha Anywhere can be used in Xdialogs. The following video show how you can embed custom charts in your own Xdialogs.

Video Number DT3. The Xdialogs shown in the above video are all in the sample 'Learning Xdialog' database that shipped with V11. Since there are many example scripts in 'Learning Xdialog' that would be useful to have quick access to, regardless of which database you are working in, we show in this video how you can easily create a Code Library from the examples in 'Learning Xdialog'.

case.title: Forms - Embedded Charts - Charting Summary Data
case.description: Video Number DT4. The charts that you embed on a Form or Report can plot summary data. The charts can either be defined declaratively, or you can use custom Xbasic. These videos show how a chart that summarizes attendees at a seminar by state can be defined using the built-in Chart Genie, or using Xbasic. The sample database used in the videos can be [downloaded here].
